title: Chekhov in Performance
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description: Chekov In Performance is a studio based exploration of the world of Anton Chekhov, focusing on acting technique through scene work as well as character analysis and development. The class will consist of close reading, rehearsal, research presentations, and occasional performance. This course is meant to promote truthful talking and listening, living moment to moment, a willingness to take risks regardless of outcome, playing from impulses in oneself and the text, personalizing circumstances and a better understanding of how to develop character. The course will use scenes from IVANOV, THE SEAGULL, UNCLE VANYA, THE THREE SISTERS and THE CHERRY ORCHARD to launch into an exploration of The Five Questions which stem from Stanislavskyâ€™s work with Chekhov. While progressing through a sequence of short scenes and then longer scenes, the stress will be on understanding an acting technique that hinges upon an experiential exchange of energy between actors in pursuit of objectives. 1 Credit. Tuition $4,200. Session A: May 27 - June 28.
